bioghist.p: Organized on March 4, 1880 as the Buffalo Lumber and Stave Exchange, a collective of lumber dealers dedicated to pursuing common interests. James N. Scatcherd served as the first president, C.A. Sweet as vice-president, and C.W. Baldy as secretary and treasurer. In 1886 the name was changed to the Buffalo Lumber Exchange. Over the years the Lumber Exchange was involved with the regulation of railroad freight rates, pricing, elimination of grade crossings, the improvement of Buffalo Harbor, and state and national legislation. The Buffalo Lumber Exchange celebrated its 100th anniversary in 1980.

scopecontent.p: Minutes of the Buffalo Lumber Exchange, Jan. 1880-Jan. 1887, Mar. 1889-Feb. 1905, April 1907-Dec. 1924, Jan. 1930-May 1950, and Dec. 1952-Nov. 1956; correspondence, including meeting notices, receipts, and industry notices, 1904-1955; luncheon registers, 1921-1931; account books, 1880-1908, and 1935-1946; memorial fund register, 1927- 1928, and memorials, 1934-1942; papers concerning the Lumber Exchangeâ€™s participation in home shows, 1953-1958; a history of the Western New York lumber industry; and obituaries and other papers concerning H. Shumway Lee and Harrison B. Mixer, members of the Lumber Exchange, 1925 and 1952.

arrangement.p: Organized into eight series: I. Minutes, 1880-1956. II. Constitution and bylaws, 1936, 1941. III. Correspondence, 1904-1955. IV. Luncheon registers, 1921-1931. V. Account books, 1880-1908 and 1935-1942. VII. Home shows, 1953-1958. VIII. Lumber industry history, 1859-1952. Chronological arrangement within series.
